title: Services set for Malin boy who died of gunshot wound
content:
Klamath County District Attorney Rob Patridge said an autopsy is scheduled this morning, with the results to be announced later in the day.
Patridge said other details of the investigation, such as how Howard came to be in possession of the rifle, might not be released until after the autopsy,
According to information submitted to the Herald and News by Howard’s family, a celebration of life service will be held Tuesday at 6 p.m. in the Broadway Theater in Malin.
Another gathering to remember him is scheduled for Saturday, at 1 p.m. at 9425 Matney Way in Klamath Falls.
